info.title: AODocs REST API
info.description: The AODocs REST API exposes most of the features of AODocs. It can be used to implement custom applications, third-party integration, bulk tools, or just to experiment with AODocs.

tags.name: folder
tags.description: Lets you list existing folders, update folders, create new folders, ...

parameters.name: enforceUniqueName
parameters.description: Whether to prevent creating two folders with the same name and same path

delete.description: Removes folder with id folderId according to deleteMode

get.description: List folders under folder with id folderId, possible loading only direct children
Load necessary folders as trees to display selectedFolder in the context of displayRootFolder applying filter from the view
Load necessary folders to display selectedFolder in the context of displayRootFolder

post.description: Applies the permissions of the provided folder to its content recursively

get.description: Loads folder permissions and related flags in Secured Folder and Document Management libraries

parameters.name: includePermissionInheritanceFlag
parameters.description: Lets you see if a folder permission is inherited or explicit

post.description: Updates folder permissions and related flags in Secured Folder and Document Management libraries
Moves folder with id folderId to folder parentId (must be in the same library)
Restores folder with id folderId from trash into folder targetFolderId.

get.description: (DO NOT USE - use list/listFromDisplayRoot) Loads all folders in a library. WARNING! This method can be very inefficient, prefer listFolders/listFoldersFromDisplayRoot methods.

put.description: (Deprecated - use create) Creates a folder in library libraryId with parent parentFolderAodocsId

parameters.name: parentFolderAodocsId
parameters.description: If absent, folder is created under the library root

get.description: (DO NOT USE - use list) List folders under folder with id folderAodocsId, possible loading only direct children

parameters.name: folderAodocsId
parameters.description: If absent, lists folders under the library root

get.description: (Deprecated - use get) Loads folder with id folderAodocsId in library libraryId

post.description: (Deprecated - use rename) Renames folder with id folderAodocsId

delete.description: (Deprecated - use remove) Removes folder with id folderAodocsId in library libraryId according to deleteMode

get.description: Loads trashed folders and documents in folder with id referenceFolderId

post.description: Moves multiple folders and documents into the parent folder
Removes multiple folders and documents according to deleteMode

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason for deleting the documents

post.description: Restores multiple folders and documents from trash into folder targetFolderId.

name.description: The displayed name of the user

nonGoogle.description: This user is not a google user

thumbnailPictureUrl.description: The URL of the thumbnail picture of the user

additionalRoles.description: The additional roles for the permission like COMMENTER

allowlisted.description: Whether the email address is allowlisted (individually or via its domain) in the current domain

belongsToDomain.description: Whether the email address is part of the current domain

email.description: The email of the permission or the domain name if type = DOMAIN

googleEmailAddress.description: Whether the email address is tied to a Google account

name.description: The displayed name for the permission

permissionId.description: The unique ID for the permission in Drive

role.description: The role of the permission: READER, WRITER, OWNER

thumbnailPhotoUrl.description: The URL of the thumbnail picture of the permitted user or group

type.description: The type of permission in Drive: ANYONE, DOMAIN, GROUP, USER

withLink.description: Whether the permission imposes to have the link to access (vs. can be searched for)

inherited.description: Indicates whether the permission is inherited from a parent

name.description: The displayed name for the permission: the name of the user or the group, or the display name of the role (read-only)

name_i18n.description: If there is an internationalized name of the permission e.g. in the case of system roles (read-only)

thumbnailPhotoUrl.description: The URL of the thumbnail picture of the permitted user or group (read-only)

value.description: The email of the user of group, the id of the role or field, the name of the domain, empty otherwise

editable.description: Whether the folder is editable by the current user (read-only field)

editableDocuments.description: Whether the documents in the folder are editable by the current user (read-only field)

fileId.description: The ID of the folder in Drive

folderAodocsId.description: The ID of the folder in AODocs model (0 if root folder)

folderDefinitionId.description: (Deprecated) The ID of the folder configuration

folderIsRoot.description: Whether the folder is the root folder (read-only field)

parentFolderAodocsId.description: The ID of the parent folder in AODocs model (0 if root folder)

parentFolderDriveId.description: The ID of the parent folder in Drive

parentFolderIsRoot.description: Whether the parent folder is the root folder (read-only field)

permittedOperations.description: The list of permitted operations to the current user (read-only field)

resourceKey.description: A folder that is shared with the link may only be discovered with this resourceKey

restrictedDownload.description: Whether the documents in the folder are marked as restricted to download, copy and print (for the readers)

drivePermissions.description: Collection of Drive permissions. See ApiDrivePermission

restrictedDownload.description: Whether the attachments of the documents are explicitly marked as restricted to download, copy and print for readers and commenters

inheritPermissions.description: Whether the folder inherits permissions from its parent folder

inheritedRestrictedDownload.description: Whether the attachments of the document are restricted to download, copy and print for readers and commenters because of an ancestor (read-only)

restrictedDownload.description: Whether the attachments of the documents are explicitly marked as restricted to download, copy and print for readers and commenters
